means: 使（协议、计划等）成书面文字形式( formalize的过去式和过去分词)
使成为正式，使具有一定形式

sentence.Network_en: A recent treaty signed by Russia, Canada and Japan formalized an agreement to work together to stop the pirates.
sentence.Network_cn: 俄罗斯、加拿大和日本最近签署的一项条约将三国共同防止盗版的协议正式确定下来。

sentence.Network_en: In the West, job interviews are highly formalized and systematic.
sentence.Network_cn: 在西方，工作面试是非常正式和系统化的。

sentence.Network_en: There are definite conditions surrounding the formalized process of schooling.
sentence.Network_cn: 这就是对学院教育模式化过程的明确解释.

list.abs: 高一英语单词表 - 豆丁网 ... South Carolina 南卡罗来纳州（美国州名） formal adj 正式的；正规的 error n 错误；差错.
西方正式（formal）着装高度制度化（highly codified）并有固定定义（fixed definition），但非正式（casual）着装则变化迅速，女装 …
形式主义（formalism），指在艺术、文学、与哲学上，对形式而非内容的着重。有形式主义行为的人，被称为“形式主义者”。
手字的解释---在线新华字典 ... 手心〖 thepalmofthehand〗 手续〖 procedures;formality〗 手眼〖 stunt〗.

entry.def: If you formalize a plan, idea, arrangement, or system, you make it formal and official.

example.ex: A recent treaty signed by Russia, Canada and Japan formalized an agreement to work together to stop the pirates...
example.tran: 俄罗斯、加拿大和日本最近签署的一项条约将三国共同防止盗版的协议正式确定下来。

example.ex: She feels the time has come to formalise her relationship with Tempelsman.
example.tran: 她觉得是时候正式确定和坦佩尔斯曼的关系了。

means.word_mean: 1. concerned with or characterized by rigorous or adherence to recognized forms (especially in religion or art);
2. given formal standing or endorsement; made official or legitimate by the observance of proper procedures

auth_sentence.content: The enactment of the Law of the People's Bank of China in 1995 formalized its central banking powers.
auth_sentence.res_content: The enactment of the Law of the People's Bank of China in 1995 formalized its central banking powers.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The enactment of the Law of the People's Bank of China in 1995 formalized its central banking powers.
